Photo of The Mad Greek of Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gyro platter at The Mad Greek in Charlotte

iCVnBn2_NXFytW80dADt3A.text: Great little greek restaurant. Not one bad thing in any category to say. I just had a gyro and fries and its spot on good. I don't usually give 5 stars on one visit but I couldn't justify any lower. I highly recommend

B9wHbeWLjb8tF0rd1fTojQ.text: Delicious gyro and chicken souvlaki pitas!! Also the staff is very nice and friendly!

peKAhxPkunsI4YteLwNCEw.text: Awesome Greek salad. Great hummus and pita. Service can be a bit slow but overall the service was good.

yYu8-_LmsYKE5_A4IaamyQ.text: This place has the best Greek salad I've ever eaten in my life. All the components come together in perfect harmony. The pita bread was fresh and delicious and I couldn't get enough of the Tzatziki. However, for my entree I ordered the $16 Lamb Chops, and ended up getting four 1cm thick slices of gristle. Definitely NOT lamb chops in the first place, and what they gave me was 100% gristle, not a single fleck of actual meat. Completely unacceptable to serve a customer, in my opinion. They were pretty nice about allowing me to switch it out for something else, though. I got the spanakopita and it was delicious. The other people I was with got different types of gyros and everyone was pleased with their meals.

LSWCohQK6OShW5yADKihrA.text: They are open until 3am! For the late night munchies, this is a great option.   The fries are great (hot, crisy, yet soft in the middle) and the gyro was flavorful. The desserts looked good and sweet, I'll try one next time. They serve breakfast all day long...good to know.  The inside definitely gives off a small diner feel. It's clean, the staff is attentive and nice, and all around a good late night pick.

W4JfIOEtAVyIY9c6ouKeZQ.text: I love this place! They are as Greek as it gets from the flavorful food to the group of men hanging out under the grapevine playing dominoes. If you want truly authentic Greek food then come here. It is not a fancy restaurant and you could possibly drive right by it on South Blvd if you aren't looking but if you do pass it do a U and come back. The fries are fantastic and the rest food is wonderful. Order the Gyro plate and you will be stuffed to the gills. They don't skimp on food! The tzatziki is to die for (and almost as good as my mother in law's) and you won't get frozen gyro slices from a box.

TEna4C8wA-JIU1Um89RFPg.text: Like others, I was on this side of town a quiet Sunday morning...you know, when almost nothing else is open in Charlotte unless you want to positively battle the church crowd?! I was also jonesin' for a gyro and The Mad Greek (previously Hugo's Diner) seemed to be a convenient choice.   Inside, this place is definitely not much to look at. I doubt the booths or floors have been changed up since the late '80s and there was a sticky quality to the place. However, it's a diner. It's open until 4 am on the weekends, I half expected that.   Service was very friendly from the (owner - I believe) slingin' Greek greens in the kitchen to our server. As with the decor, the menu is straightforward. It's also worth noting that they do serve breakfast all day - pancakes, omelettes, breakfast sandwiches, waffles, etc.   Since it was almost noon, I went with the classic gyro sandwich. A well made, soft but toasty pita filled with gyro meat, tzatizki, onions and tomato. I decided to forgo the fries and snag a greek salad for $1 more. The gyro was tasty, warm and just what I was looking for. The salad was fine but the Greek dressing wasn't my fave...even though I'm certain they make it in house.   So, with good service, good food why not 4 stars? Well, others may disagree with me, but I found it a bit overpriced for what I received. The gyro, while tasty, wasn't giant like the others I've had. For example, Steak & Hoagie shop serves up a gyro for a bit over $4...here it's moderately sized and $7.95 (including fries). Hubs and I had two gyros, one with a side salad and one with a dinner salad and it cost us $27 with tip. That seems a bit steep for just a couple of gyros and salads. Regardless, if I was in the area and seeking a gyro, The Mad Greek would be a decent stop.

IusAI0HYP5H7-vqlEA26ow.text: Hands down, best Greek food I've had on the road during my 7 years of travel. Mind you, I am mostly vegetarian, so my choices are in that genre. The Village Salad was just like I remembered from my honeymoon in Greece: beautiful chunks of veggies with a light oil dressing and spices.  Superb!  I know spanakopita is not on the list for road warriors watching their waist line, but it was the best I ever had!  No kidding.  I usually only eat half off meals on the road. Polished it off. So tasty.  Homemade too. I think that was one of my top ten best meals ever on the road for work.

9WFGY9lcn05Vs6zaPstIPA.text: Salad was great, extremely fresh cucumber and tomato!  Chicken spiced just right and really moist.   Tzatziki sauce was some of the best I've ever eaten.  Small dining area .  Felt sorry for the ONE waitress, she was having to run the take out orders in front plus waiting on dining room !   But she gave polite efficient service no frills.  Will defiantly be back to eat  at the Mad Greek on my next trip to Southpark mall

orCiryhOFM27jXHfEnxyMQ.text: Great Greek food! The gyro dinner was amazing and really filling. The only thing that was less than perfect was the service. They could use a few more employees so the one server didn't seem so frazzled. This was not an issue at all because we enjoyed the food so much but I would think twice about coming here more often. Take out for sure next time!

mSR1YELlzt3GBGtDGXkPwQ.text: I found the Mad Greek by chance one day a couple of years ago when I was waiting around on my car to be repaired across the street. Greek food is my absolute favorite, so I had to try this authentic-looking blue and white diner on South Blvd. I ordered the gyro pita and it was AMAZING. Perfectly cooked, delicious, tender gyro meat with fantastic tzaziki sauce and a deliciously warm pita. This place stayed on my mind when I came back to Charlotte last year. Their hummus is delicious - the type of delicious where the little pool of oil forms on top and makes for a perfect gob of goodness on pita bread. Their gyro meat has never let me down. It is always the perfection I expect! Their baklava is very tasty for dessert as well, and I also enjoy the Greek salad. I've never tried their breakfast, but apparently it's served all day. When I want my top choice comfort food/the tiny Greek diner experience that reminds me of home, this place is the perfect destination in Charlotte.

3dgoogsesyaGK28AB_K2UQ.text: Just came back from my lunch at The Mad Greek, and let's just say I am loving the gyro.  I contemplated about saving half of it for later, but what do you know, I ate the whole darn thing.  Meaty, tasty, with just enough tzatziki sauce and lettace, tomato & onion, decent portion, along with fries that's lightly seasoned (hey... I give them credit for at least trying to make standard frozen fries more appealing... not saying that they succeeded).  The gyro is one of their daily lunch specials for $6.95, other options are: cheeseburger, chicken strips, grill chicken breast sandwich, kebab/chicken/souvlaki pita, all serves with french fries.  Let me clarify that I'm mostly writing about the food because this is definitely a "dumpy" looking place, with minimum service, and in my opinion the menu is a little lacking and kinda pricey for a joint like this.  But for a quick lunch, it's solid and I'll be back to try the kebab pita.

fTScIq_80eL82l81nMQs2Q.text: Best greek food I've had.  Everything was so fresh and tasty.  Ive had many gyros in my life but these are the best.  Small mom n pop kinda place but who cares. This is authentic!

k5CnovpKiy_0vbugvH5B4Q.text: We had gyro dinner and it was awesome!For $10 you get a lot if meat, pita bread, salad, greek sauce,and homemade fries.We had baklava as well and it tasted great!The place doesnt look really nice but the food is great!

48nEGT5s069N2n4yYJhMvg.text: Secret bomb.com food! And very reasonably priced!! Even though I'm very selective on good food and don't often really notice it, I have to say this place is a great find for reliably good food and service. When you go, ask for Nicole because she's simply great.

p3_UmctxG3po6loVrHYCCw.text: After years of searching and having to settle for mediocre Greek food,  I have finally found an amazing gyro in town. First, they actually have a spit here where they roast the meat and slice it off. Secondly, the pita is toasted on the grill and thirdly, holy moly, they pack the gyro meat into that pita. Top it all off with lettuce, tomato, onion and their (sour creme based, not my preference but still very good) tatziki sauce. FINALLY finally, a gyro worth mentioning. Fries are great as well. They are fresh cut and appear to be  tossed with some lemon and herbs. Also, delicious.  As for the ascetics of the place...it's a Greek diner. Nothing fancy and it doesn't need to be. Its good food at an affordable price, served by a friendly staff. I have not tried any thing else on the menu yet, but based on how good  the gyro is i bet other options wont disappoint. Hopefully, i will get around to it once my love affair with the gyro tapers off.

4peJew8d3a6V6yzWpo3wDQ.text: The fly swatting by the guy behind the counter threw me off a little but good http.

eC7xhJB6ixi2TuakgzH0vg.text: I love Greek food and the Mad Greek did not disappoint. Loved the casual atmosphere, the salad was phenomenal, spanakopita was amazing and the Kebab dinner was exceptional!

58956weZJKQp80qEBfrX3A.text: Disclaimer:  This review is based solely on their amazing gyros.  I'm sure they have excellent other choices on their menu, but I feel like I'll be ordering their gyros every time I go there.  I've had a hard time finding gyros that I really like in Charlotte, but theirs blows away any I've had any where.  The portions on the gyro dinner were huge too,  we both left with plenty of left overs.  Now if they would just install a drive through, and stay open till one in the morning.

q5Jeqb8iZAgUYFXZnz4A_A.text: With Charlotte lacking late night eats, I was excited to grab a gyro here after seeing all the decent to great reviews.  Anticipating that they're open until 3:00 am, as stated here, I was totally bummed when I drove by at 10:45 pm and saw that they were closed.  If I ever get to try them when open, I'll update my review.

h3kOTmF98-8c5nGSpe5wdQ.text: Am from NY, but every time I am in the area, my girlfriend and I make it a point to stop at the Mad Greek and visit Chris and his friendly crew, especially for a good home cookin' breakfast.  Granted the place is a little rough around the edges, but I always enjoy the marinated chicken and/or ribeye with eggs.  They have solid home fries as well.  This may sound basic, but the piece de resistance of the Mad Greek is the fresh squeezed orange juice that they crank out, it's fantastic!  Best OJ this side of South Florida, stuff is like orange flavored crack in a glass!  And, if you like Greek football (aka soccer), it's on 24/7 - was there during the World Cup last year and had a blast watching it with the staff while enjoying my meal, good people.

XU3Ak1ULjNu8qrFAJ0CfOA.text: Amazing and just what I was looking for! Great prices, fast service, and friendly people who work there.

rF0wt6WwbwrGO7csJiAaSw.text: The Mad Greek finally finished their renovations, and the place is 1000% IMPROVED! Food is still delicious, and prices extremely reasonable for what you get. I'm giving it 5 STARS because the owner Chris took the time and effort to turn his formerly dumpy restaurant into a MUCH improved, more modern diner.  I STILL think this is THE best Greek food in Charlotte, just nudging out The Greek Isles (which is excellent as well and more fancy).

_7nBwXRQaUhUYVgIHUCFQQ.text: Im Greek straight from Athens and im fed up with the Americanized fast food-like "greek" food ive had stateside by Greek americans who cant speak our language well on top of that. I cook myself all of the dishes this place serves and I have a very hard to please taste and I approve of them. From the fresh fish to the gyro meat and everything I tried, it's like i was at Lesvos island at a tavern by the beach. The owner Chris is warm-hearted (like real Greeks :D) and loads all the plates - no measuring no stinginess thats the greek spirit. At first I visited with my mom and her husband, we did not know anything about this place and we ordered a bit of everything, we had a blast. One thing i have to say is Chris needs to expel the old greek dudes often hanging out at the deck cuz theyre rowdy and i think they try to hurt his business(they make fun of him cooking in the kitchen smh). He puts his heart in this restaurant. He cooks everything himself along with another Greek guy (they both speak Greek perfectly) and he grows some of his own veggies in the back. The sweets are handmade and authentic (one time we brought a Greek walnut pie (karydopita) for him for free of course and he offered it to customers).

MxbFRefzBEv9D0npR-qVgg.text: This is the best greek food I have ever had. The owner/chef goes out of his way to make you feel welcome. His kebob, gyro, greek salad  & custard dessert (cannot recall the greek name) is amazing.

7jQWlEoiRI8ivzYlewxzlQ.text: This is a great little place and wonderful food.  No frills and welcoming service.  Will be adding it to our place list!

H_eWMsLnON8ekjHQGv3z2Q.text: This is my favorite Greek restaurant in Charlotte. We always order takeout because we live near by, but their staff is friendly for dining in.  The interior isn't posh by any means but it is representative of the Greek culture and we appreciate them staying True to their roots, especially when it comes to the menu. Their gyro's can fix any bad day, their fries are the perfect texture and their tzatsiki is so good - we pay $2 every time we order for extra sides of it for our fries. Go in with an open mind, you won't be disappointed!

gN5uuQeauw2qiDn0SXmGvg.text: the only reason i am giving 4 stars is because the younger girl working up front today march 26 was absolutely rude. as soon as we walked in she was talking with the older lady (who is amazing by the way) telling her that some food she was going to eat was old and she wasn't eating it .. it kind of made me wanted to leave but we stayed because of the other reviews. the young girl ruined the atmosphere for my family. i would recommend this place to people even if she is there. cursing in front of customers, especially a family with young kids is unacceptable:

AiD0Dl-h_AUQmAasQJL8XQ.text: Hands down the BEST Greek restaurant I've been to since relocating to NC! This is my second time having their food and both times were amazing! The first time I had a carry out and was amazed at the amount of food I got was impressive; but not as impressive as the quality of the food...my inner fat girl was very pleased! Today, we dined in and I ordered the kabob lunch special...my inner fat girl was yet again pleased. In addition to the quality of the food, the service was exceptional as well. Being within walking distance from my job, it makes for a nice, to key and delicious lunch break. Did I mention the fries? Fresh cut potatoes....AMAZEballs! The prices are competitive as well. You get more than your money's worth here. My inner fat girl is pretty picky...but when she's happy, I'm happy.

7YHHTea-SRTPCXOdHpr8LA.text: I was a little concerned when we pulled up to the restaurant as it looked dated. It was a full house when we arrived. Our server was nice and appeared to be working hard.   I was pleasantly surprised by the food. My wife had the souvlaki and I had the gyro dinner. Portions were filling and tasted great.   I would definitely return if we came back.

fqVFfT4llLZD0wHi1-SAQQ.text: Decent Greek food! Gyro meat wasn't the best I've ever had but pretty close, fresh and hot and I really liked their fries. I also tried their baklava it was homemade and delicious! Place is super small, probably better for take out but worth a try!

RIPcRbtJksqsjgBUHWhj0A.text: I ordered the small greek salad. When it arrived, you would have thought it was a large. The ingredients wwre fresh, as well. The restaurant is very clean, and the staff is great. If I had to recommend a Greek restaurant, this would definitely be it.

_ILdFxF971EcOpfqMuMttQ.text: Basic decor, nothing fancy. Food is very tasty and reasonably priced. Will definitely be returning!

2DEiuwUy4sRlukJA-z41WA.text: Hands down, the BEST tzatziki I have ever had. Gryro's are awesome as well!! Affordable, friendly place to get a quick bite to eat.

Mxm-gPTbO3Sh86AzQ6ohCQ.text: Service was exceptional this evening and the food was awesome. Appreciate all the other great reviews that led us here to begin with! A definite place to stop for Greek food.

5ZgycMfwIokzG2ptH7DQHg.text: I like Greek food, but I have to say, this is some of the best I have had outside of Greece.  I can't wait to come back.  Had the Gyros and it was simply amazing.  I wanted desert,but the entree was so good I didn't leave any room.  Oh, yeah, they serve breakfast all day!

8JopXLP_XxiRGsSo-qOV0w.text: The restaurant itself is not very fancy in terms of interiors and Furnitures. The service is great and prompt. The pita bread here stands out, very tasty and is served hot. We had ordered baba ganoush and this combined with the pita bread was really good. After this the salads came over which were nice. The entree we ordered had a good portion of chicken. Chicken is very subtle in terms of spices and salt, for my taste, but cooked to perfection. The rice served along was plain white rice. Also ordered a bottle of Greek beer, it's reasonably prized and I liked it. All in all a good experience and I would recommend this to friends.

sYI1c7OdraqnTzsHyM79Qw.text: Solid Greek food with a solid Greek atmosphere.  You know you're in the right spot when you see actual Greeks coming in to order the gyro's!  The tzatziki sauce was thick and tasty with just the right amount of tang for the lamb.  Some douche of customer took off without paying, but the owner and the waitress maintained their calm and professionalism.  I admire that, cuz I would have been a True "Mad Greek" had it been me getting shafted!  Good people, good food. Noosh!

photos.caption: Photo of The Mad Greek of Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. less than $10

pTTJYBsX24FpyAEDDYyVFg.text: Try to overlook the sort of rundown state of the building - the food is consistently great here! I have tried a couple of dishes but always return to the Greek salad with grilled chicken - my fave salad in Charlotte!

yvDG3JopUF20H7z-DufLmw.text: I'd heard that, when visiting Charlotte, The Mad Greek was a place you had to visit. I did and...WOW! After years of subpar Greek-like restaurants, I finally had the real thing! My husband had the gyro (which I sampled -- to die for!) and I had the Kabob. The Greek salad that started my meal was authentic and deliciously fresh. The Kabob was, again, real Greek cooking (two lamb slabs with sauteed onion and tomato) the freshest and most tasty pitas I've ever eaten and the fries that accompanied it all were home-made, hot and delicious. The baklava is primo and the custard dessert we sampled made me want to cry out, "OPA!" The next time I'm in Charlotte, you can bet I'll be dining at The Mad Greek. Over and over again. Tremendously recommended!

i65hrS9C6Y23oAiqpAzXeA.text: Well. I don't think the people in there are Greek for one. Second do not expect a restaurant that is for sure. It's more like a hole in the wall. Lady told me the gyro meet was cut off the leg like in NY. It's most definitely not. Any vendor in NY that serves gyros would put this joint out of business. The only reason we stopped was because we tried to find something else and every time it said a place was open it was closed. Finally got sick of it and just pulled in

LSyJ5-9WcJ-NdalBgEURwQ.text: Yummy! I have been searching for some good Greek food ever since I moved from Florida to NC. Food was fresh, hot and tasty. Pricing fair. Portions good. Staff friendly. The restuarant could use a makeover though. The food is worth it! I will be back again with more of my family.

jnvkZ52CYGaVn8DEK2ygEQ.text: This is my second visit to this location.  The service and food once again excellent. Thank you "..Mad Greek"

ea7jvC4tLySK5XQ_TLxrAQ.text: Authentic REAL GREEK food.  Seriously.  Homemade and delicious.  I'm Greek and a very picky purveyor of Greek food.  This is very good.  And you'll hear Greek spoken here.   I love their pork souvlaki (pork chunks grilled on a kebob and put in a pita.   Their horiatiki (village) salad is terrific.  No lettuce, just tomatoes, cucumbers and feta.  Delicious. Spinach pie and frappe (Greek iced coffee) is yummy.  For dessert, the baklava is great.   Out of all the places I've tried, Estia's Kouzina in Belmont, Greco Fresh Grill, The Akropolis, this is the best and the most authentic.    Another place that has good (much more upscale tho) Greek food is Ilios Noche.

CpdDX7KI-PbStppEZ_DslA.text: Fabulous Greek food!  Every time I go to Charlotte I must have a meal from here. Door is great and the service is even better.

4oXPDpGQFBAbT5cFbsx8hg.text: An old school looking diner with a Greek flair. This place serves breakfast and Greek food. I enjoyed a nice dinner of pork, chicken souvlaki, and shaved gyro meat with a salad, hummus, and pita bread. The portion was way too much for me to finish and I'm not a small eater! Excellent value and probably shareable between 2-3 people depending on hunger.  Service was quick and efficient. Will return.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mad Greek of Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mad Greek meat platter
Photo of The Mad Greek of Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salad and pita bread
Photo of The Mad Greek of Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu

vDX_L0L42u4XqAn0SyJClw.text: How ive neber been here before is beyond me.  Went with what they are known for, a gyro.  The grecian shaved chicken gyro was amazing.  So flavorful, and a lot of food.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mad Greek of Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grecian shaved chicken gyro

ZmCtnShNbMrErg0cP23PPQ.text: My wife and I ate here yesterday. We always like to try Greek and Middle Eastern places. We used to live outside of Detroit and have eaten at some of the best in the country. Mad Greek did not disappoint! There is a brother and sister team who does the serving. They know the menu and are very friendly! In the kitchen are the elders of the family. And they are killing it back there!! We had the $16.95 appetizer sampler. It had: fresh tomatoes, feta, cucumbers, red onions, hummus, taziki, gyro meat, grape leaves, and spanakopita! Outstanding! We also shared a gyro with Greek fries! Definitely get the Greek fries! They are seasoned and topped with feta. Great flavor and not overpowering. For dessert we tried their home made Baklava... dang! That's all I can say... dang! Do not leave without a piece of Baklava! We are not from Charlotte but every time we come back to town, we will go to Mad Greek! Thank you guys!

vqveQZ9VSrym7-aFHsClJA.text: I'm only in CLT a couple times a year and always make it a point to stop here. Did a carry out order tonight for me and the fam. The crew at Mad Greek took care of us, and as always, the food was spectacular. Can never get enough pita. Seriously, the best Greek food in CLT.

QzBaRldTC56RemCobAga1A.text: I have come here on quite a few occasions and The mad Greek Cafe has not let me down! Small little cafe and service is pretty quick I have definitely had enough time during my lunch hour to sit and enjoy the food and didn't feel rushed. The fries and definitely homemade and delicious! Last time I was here I ordered the pork skewers and man are they good. Seasoned nicely and nice and juicy a little dip in the yogurt sauce it really is so good I just don't have the words. Worth a try if you're in the area.

XxvzPSCysomg8Z7frKx2Hw.text: Best grilled chicken Greek salad I've had in a long time... ordered take out and devoured my salad... enough to make 2 small salads

photos.caption: Photo of The Mad Greek of Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Greek chicken salad

H5AHdtmkDvbxuc3sJFmTDA.text: My first time here and I loved it. Of course I had to get a classic gyro. It came with a side of fries. The gyro meat was perfectly good juicy and tender. The fries were fresh cut and seasoned well. I was so FULL by the end of my meal in a good way. I also got some baklava to go that was amazing. Definitely will be back to try everything else that have to offer. The menu included salads, pita hamburgers, soup, grape leaves, and even breakfast! You won't regret going here . Oh and the service was great and quick.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mad Greek of Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Baklava
Photo of The Mad Greek of Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gyro

rlzvWouoSea3_48sYJH9bw.text: I recently went to the Mad Greek after about over a year of not going and I'm wondering why I waited so long to go back! This place is great! My go to is the gyro pita. The pita is filled with lots of fresh meat and I love their tzatziki sauce. You definitely will not get another gyro in CLT that's loaded this much- unless it was my lucky day!   Each pita also comes with a choice of side, and I recommend the rice. It's light and fluffy- super buttery. Tip-Get an order of the hummus and mix some in with your rice! So good!   Overall, the Mad Greek is very authentic and family owned, which I love. You will always see their family members hanging out around the restaurant - and they play Greek shows/movies in the dining area.   And for the lack of traditional Greek restaurants in CLT, the Mad Greek is definitely a top contender.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mad Greek of Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gyro with side of rice. Lunch $9. So good and huge!

DMQRgSlIJe4ltm-I_Vcj1A.text: Not bad. Not great, 3.5 stars would be my rating. The Greek salad was nice and balanced and the dressing good, not sure it was "Greek" but I enjoyed it. The service was just middle of the road. It feels family-owned but I didn't feel the love in the food or the atmosphere. I've been there numerous times I find the food always to be 3 1/2 to 4 stars. If you're in the area I might pop in if craving greek food. But I wouldn't drive way out of my way to do eat there. But don't avoid it, others seem to love it it may just not be in my wheelhouse.

JHmh-ryrwsr1WGipOtAZuA.text: The best chicken gyro you will have in town. Friend got feta fries and I'm sorry I didn't- they are so good!! Spanakopita was fresh and flaky.  Will make this a regular spot

photos.caption: Photo of The Mad Greek of Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Feta fries -delicious!

iDlBUsDDhUaaQF_SOLvlKg.text: This place is so good! My friend and I went here for lunch on a Sunday, there was no wait and the food was out quickly, which was great because we were hungry and everything smelled so good. I got the gyro entree plate, which came with a absolutely delicious green salad. Super crisp lettuce and a fresh dressing that was so tasty! The gyro plate came with gyro meat, French fries, pita bread, and tzatziki sauce. Everything was full of flavor, especially the tzatziki sauce, which was thick and delightfully herb-y. I was too full to eat dessert there, but you have to get a baklava to go, their baklava is amazing, and such a good portion too. Definitely make The Mad Greek one of your stops when you're in Charlotte!

photos.caption: Photo of The Mad Greek of Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

2setgfqpHJEXW2Y-vqd6hQ.text: We've never had a bad meal here! Great food, and the staff is super friendly. You cannot go wrong with anything on their menu.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mad Greek of Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. This place is amazing. We have never had a bad meal here, this is the philly steak gyro.

j7mYp1b-Mb-WSTrvVGqPqw.text: Great little place that is right around the corner from my house, so needless to say I have stopped in a few times for lunch. Overall The Mad Greek matches expectations for serving classic Greek food with very Greek themed decorations. The staff is super friendly and the food is really good too. Portions are large so bring a friend or come hungry.   I highly recommend the hummus and pita and anything with gyro meat. Also don't sleep on the Greek coffee - served at 1 million degrees but delicious. They also have a nice covered patio that is great when the weather is warm. If you want to take a quick trip in spirit and taste to the Mediterranean, then the Mad Greek is certainly a good bet!

l9xpp-t0L2Ls9hGTbMK35A.text: Super good. Everyone working there is Greek and knows what they're doing! Service is fast, veggies are fresh, and dressings/sauces are awesome. The meat is the highlight. We ordered both Grecian chicken and gyros with the lamb/beef mix and I have not had it anywhere better in the US.

c9IS0xQnaUUgfynymx4frw.text: Editing this review because the service has gone severely downhill since my original review on 11/2017. I visit this restaurant occasionally and it used to be delicious but now it's hit or miss. Today the service was awful, air conditioning didn't seem to be working and they went from amazing hand cut fries to generic frozen crinkle fries. The Greek half chicken was dry and didn't live up to expectations. I will no longer recommend this restaurant to others. PREVIOUS REVIEW: Hands down best chicken pita in the Charlotte area. I  have driven by many times without even noticing It was there. Today was the first time I've stopped and I will absolutely be back for more. Thank you!!

rNdtyyZ3wC6zvQPm0Pgckw.text: By far the best Greek food in town. Run by a very nice Greek family- everything is authentic and reasonably priced. You can't go wrong with chicken pita and gyro pita!

photos.caption: Photo of The Mad Greek of Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Pita
Photo of The Mad Greek of Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gyro Greek Salad

_JJAjiZ4gftsVD-loSeQDg.text: Finally made it! This place had been in my bookmarks for a long time. It's a total dive! The chicken pita was delish! I was a little disappointed with the Greek salad. The ingredients weren't as fresh as I had hoped. Don't expect anything fancy. The service is good. Worth a trip!

3vx1h1OTnd_g4sU-Q3wFmQ.text: Mad Greek .. very good authentic Greek food. Very easy going environment. Sometimes the food is on or off, my only complaint but usually on.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mad Greek of Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Comfortable environment

3TyWJN42931s-cywjGTHXg.text: We had gyros, pork chops and a cheeseburger. Everyone enjoyed their food. Hand cut fries were a pleasant surprise. We'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mad Greek of Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dessert!

H97jX3vgoqFDoJbrkGchNQ.text: I love this place!! The Mad Greek has very authentic Greek food and many Greek workers and customers too! You will get tons of food for a reasonable price, but save room because dessert is the best part! There is always fresh baklava and other Greek pastries that taste great! I would definitely recommend this place

_MTZfLquiTFl2R3_0GXO2A.text: I hadn't been to The Mad Greek in a few years, but it wasn't nearly as good as I remembered.  I ordered a Greek Salad with Gryo meat.  The meat was very thin and dried out and the Greek dressing tasting like it had mustard in it.  Maybe that's what some prefer, but I didn't like it at all.  The bathroom was something short of clean and the floors were in need of sweeping.  The back corner of the restaurant looked like someone's office because there were papers, files, and a computer in plain site....not in a "I'm need to have lunch and do some work" type of way...it was clearly the restaurant's office.  Very strange.  With so many delicious Greek restaurants in the area, I doubt that I will return.

kep31EDXwR45Y5XG3PXBCQ.text: After a month-long traipse across Greece, I've become a Greek food snob. I read this place was touted as authentic, so I decided to give it a try.  For lunch, I got a classic gyro, which is a legitimate staple in Greece. I have to say, it was incredibly good. I could tell each ingredient was fresh - the pita hot and soft, the lettuce crispy, the gyro meat tender and full of flavor. And the tzatziki was the best I've had in Charlotte! The fries were also quite good too. A+.  The waitresses were friendly and attentive as well. The star deduction is only because of the restaurant itself. Our table was noticeably dirty, and the decor and lighting left much to be desired. The air also felt really stale and warm.  But these factors won't keep me from visiting again for another one of their delicious gyros. Maybe I'll just get takeout next time.

87coGzJSPXu-rEEit5aeVQ.text: While the food was good, our waitress went on a tirade about politics loudly, in front of the whole restaurant. That's not acceptable or good for business. It made our dining experience very uncomfortable. We will not be back.

yGDCuh-M6MirLXBf4s8oPg.text: Wow wow wow ! I'm a bit backwards and my wife talked me in to eating here.  It is amazing. The food is fantastic and the service is good. Very nice atmosphere with a friendly staff too.

SQIkuBGRA3sKF3rW05h5mw.text: We have eaten here several times and always been very very good. I get the greek salad with lamb which is outstanding,  I use the tatziki sauce as the dressing which is spot on.  The grape leaves are authentic and great. The only room for improvement I would like to see is the gyro meat be cut a little thicker. The feta is also awesome.

Pdi0ie9QyhWFphue_hd_Ng.text: Ballin Greek gyros, fresh made pittas, amazinggg tzatziki... and they don't skimp, on anything. Go here!!

0Hw8YU_ey_c1-4iyD_mkMA.text: My friend and I stopped here for lunch today. We both got a gyro and it was amazing! I'm so used to eating at Showmars that I was blown away by how good the gyros at Mad Greek are. Top NOTCH!  It also looks like they make their own deserts as well and if they taste as good as they look I'm sure I would be HUGE fan.   Service was good, no complaints, but the food really makes this place. I will be back for sure!

reCZRbu7pBae-mm9VhqPvw.text: It's a restaurant that has been around for awhile. I went for lunch with my friend (after leaving another restaurant down the road earlier that never sent a server to our table),  and the service was fine here. Someone greeted us and was pleasant, took our order and came back to check on us. So, I had no problem with service, but the food was just not good, except for the pita bread which was hot and delicious.   The fries were cold when they were brought out, my dish was okay and the baklava was soggy. The tzatziki was good, but there wasn't much of it and they wanted to charge extra for another small condiment container of it. The lettuce in the greek salad was a little limp. The tea was bitter as if it had been sitting out too long. With drinks, a piece of baklava and two lunches, we ended up paying $32 for lunch (without the tip). We both got lunch specials.  I don't really consider that "cheap" and it looked as if they had raised their prices a bit since the higher prices were stuck down over the old prices on the menu.   This was nothing special. I probably wouldn't go back.

vrtJLneEaga5LcL3qEcNEw.text: I checked out the Mad Greek today.  We were on that side of town and it popped in my head, thanks Yelp!  I dont' know if I would drive and make a special trip, but if I was in the neighborhood I would eat there again.    In the light of day, it didn't seem so clean to me.  If you are the kind of person that looks at sanitation ratings, it might not be the place for you. I didn't see what their score was and I do not care, I will eat anywhere, but I know what people like when they think of a clean restaurant.  On the upside, our server was pleasant, we ordered chicken sandwiches on pita.  It was served hot and was very filling.  It would be so much better for you to eat at the Mad Greek instead of fast food anyday.

UqhO_G7ov1vwUjGKqPP8kA.text: I stopped in on the Yelp reviews and was not disappointed! The gyro was lovely and tender. Hummus was very nice and baklava was amazing. The staff was very welcoming - almost as if invited into their home. If I'm ever back in the area, I will definitely visit!

EMUdcXwQa99fj2Bm6Gf3fA.text: What a find!  What this restaurant lacks in size it makes up in authenticity and hospitality. Great traditional Greek food, big portions, and well prepared. You know it's good when half of the restaurant is speaking Greek.

iJzL8FNol6uPXI7_XptRnA.text: Our party had gyros, which were delicious - and filling. They definitely do not skimp on the ingredients. Tasty pitas, large portion sizes, affordable prices. Highly recommended!

bAYEPFcEYKguD6aaairYzQ.text: What used to be Hugo's diner and then changed hands a few times is now back to the original owner and he's serving up pretty awesome food at great prices.  Burgers, sandwiches, Greek standards and breakfast all day.    The gyro is one of the best I've tried in town because they actually cook it on a spit and shave it off when it gets crispy the way you're supposed to (instead of pan frying up frozen strips).  My gyro and fries came out piping hot.  Will definitely be back to try their Greek chicken and other dishes.  An added bonus, they're open till 3am during the week and 4am on Fridays and Saturdays.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mad Greek of Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mad Greek Sign

yTdKEOe6Kq8WFaRxxJlkiA.text: The Mad Greek is everything I want in a Greek restaurant: interesting personnel, questionable decorating choices, no frills and great food.   The first time we ate here, we were the only patrons in the place -  I was definitely worried. The same thing happened the next time. And the time after that.... Apparently, I just pick off-times for the place, because based on the gyro, tzaziki and Greek salad, it would surprise me that the place is dead.   My go-to meal here is a large Greek salad, topped with gyro meat and a side of that heavenly tzaziki sauce. It never fails to be an absolutely satisfying meal.   The waitstaff is friendly and attentive - even after walking in after closing (oops!) our waitress INSISTED that we place an order and sit down to eat.   In talking with another waitress, we learned that The Mad Greek sources its herbs and produce either from the veggie garden on the side of the property or from the local farmers market. They also source their meats from a small meat market in Charlotte.   If you're looking for a corporate, sterile dining experience, this is definitely not it. I can't speak for much of the menue, but I will give The Mad Greek my vote for best gyro in town.

YZKn5isbEiIMo8UEQ4jIZw.text: This place is kind of an ugly dump inside and pretty weird environment so I wouldn't eat inside. However, it is great for carryout, which I sometimes get at work. The gyros are pretty good and good for the price. It is definitely adequate enough to satisfy my gyro cravings whenever I am having one. I am excited to see the renovations finished. If you want a gyro check it out. You won't be disappointed. The only place better around is Greek Isles.

iKHjNu-gh23DLOupO1WPaw.text: Let me start off by saying that the food was great. I would have gave it 4 stars, however the service was very lacking. I would have given that a 0 starts if possible. We placed our order and received our food and never saw our waitress again. We sat their with empty glasses, empty plates, and luckily we weren't in a hurry. It took her 30 minutes after we had finished to realize that we were still there and waiting for a check.   I would go back for the food, but I would try to make sure we didn't get the same service again.

z3fE-dQwjEzZgFyXWisDtw.text: Maybe the best Greek food I've had outside of Greece. We got the grape leaves appetizer, which comes with hot crispy pita, tzatziki, and a pile of super fresh feta drizzled with olive oil. The dolmades were tender and lemony and delicious, and the feta was amazing. That sounds silly; it's just feta, right?? But it was GOOD.  My mom got the appetizer spanakopita (I think it's the same as the entree, it just doesn't came w a salad or pita, which is fine w her) and it was yummy too. The filling was different from other spanakopita I've had; creamier, and with a hint of lemon. Very, very good.  I got the Greek style chicken pita w the Greek fries. A "Greek style" pita means it's served w the fries IN the sandwich, just like in Greece. The Greek fries are a little more than just plain fries, but they have feta and oregano. The fries were hand cut and HOT, so they would've been delicious plain, but the feta was nice. The pita was good; the chicken was crispy on the edges and the pita itself was both fluffy and crisp.  We'll be back!! Soon!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Mad Greek of Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Greek style chicken gyro with Greek fries (no onion or tomato on the pita)

BZHlzSAIG8IlxWCpsIWjjg.text: It pains me to write this review for what is probably the best Greek food in the area.   The portions they brought out to us were shockingly small so we mentioned that to the server...nothing was done. They refused to send out a manager to talk with us and then berated us for complaining.    When we left, some punk 20 something year old who identified himself as an owner followed us (myself and my 2 female friends) to the car badgering us about us being rude to them.  Ironic.   I did not hear this but my friend said that the waitress threatened to slap us.  Given their attitudes and other actions, this claim doesn't surprise me.   I'd recommend that no one goes to this restaurant because of their total disregard for customer service and basic decency.  Owners daughter's a liar. Their father didn't come out to diffuse the situation and I didn't approach her yelling. I told her i was pissed when she cut me off during my sentence of "I know you're really busy but we've waited for 20 min for you father." And her bf is lucky I didn't act on his ridiculous threatening stalking of me while I left. Not a very smart move pal.   And sweetheart, when you rips (you are a liar to say I threw it) someone's card out of their hand and cut them off then you deserve to be told what a scumbag you are.

6AjYmUYQP-eXLzQaqVUlTg.text: This used to be my favorite Greek restaurant in Charlotte.  Not anymore. Me and my best friend had hyped this place to my mom. And now I WILL NEVER GO BACK. We started our meal with the calamari. It was lackluster to say the least. There was barely enough calamari to cover the plate. It wasn't fresh. We said something to our waitress and she said well it comes prepackaged and that's the size you get. Well ok then. Then our food came out. My gyro and my mom's kebab plate came out first. My bff waited 20 additional minutes for his Grecian pork. He had to ask the waitress about it and she said it was coming, didn't bother to check with the kitchen. There were barely any fries on the plate. Bff finally got his food and half the ingredients were missing from his pita. We asked to speak to the manager. Then we waited 30 minutes. While we were waiting we heard waitresses refuse to serve food because there wasn't enough food on the plate (does that complaint sound familiar?) The chefs put the wrong food and sauces in bags. The waitresses were the people who saved them from their error. We got tired of waiting so we went to pay. My bff was treating us to dinner and asked they take the calamari off because of the serving size. They refused. That's when the owner of the restaurant finally came out and started yelling at us, the customer. When I say yelling I mean yelling. He said well we ate the food so clearly we enjoyed it. When we told them we ate it because we were hungry and had been waiting 30 minutes he said well then you pay and continued yelling. Our waitress ripped my friend's card out of his hand. She told us she never wanted to see us in her restaurant again and if we did come back she'd smack us. I raised the point that she had refused to serve an undersized portion to another table - it was clearly a problem the kitchen faced across the board. She yelled at me that it was a different order and had nothing to do with our meal. At this point the customers had been yelled at, verbally abused, and belittled for a reasonable complaint that was a consistent problem. What makes things worse is what happened next. A younger gentleman very closely followed my bff to the car and was berating him for complaining. We were leaving and yet we were followed out in an aggressive manner. This man, who said he owned the restaurant, proceeded to insult my elderly and disabled mom. She had said and done nothing during all of this. When he insulted her I lost it and told him to keep her out of this, to go back inside and leave us alone. He then tried to tell me how I should speak to him. We pulled off after telling him we'd never be back.  If you value a restaurant that respects its customers don't eat here. If you like good Greek food with generous portions, don't eat here. If you have friends or family who are elderly and/or disabled, don't eat here. This is the worst dining experience of my life.  I appreciate the waitresses' response however they did not try to resolve anything. We asked to speak to her father and waited, and waited. It was her father who started yelling at us through the window to the kitchen and her boyfriend who followed us out of the restaurant. Then her boyfriend tried to bring my mother - NOT my grandmother - into the situation. I've eaten at this restaurant numerous times - never asked for free food or complained. In fact I'd previously written a five star review. The way that this restaurant handled one relatively minor complaint and escalated it to us being yelled at in front of other diners is ridiculous. Given the situation of course I'm going to write a review so that others don't experience the humiliation I did.

My9geHIowCpSLCIkXGJxtg.text: Okay, so I don't know where to start. I was recommended to try this place by my YELP bestie, I love Greek food and I trusted her so why not. I walked into the restaurant and it was apparent that it has not been updated in a very long time but we decided to dine in. I was a bit sketched out to sit, but I decided to go. Working in a restaurant prior, I have a habit of observing every little detail that goes on, so while I'm sitting here I notice that not only the restaurant hasn't been updated, but neither has it been cleaned throughly either.   Moving on, I didn't realize the waitress was even our waitress because she was in gym clothing that was not suitable for the restaurant, more like hooters. She was quick to take our order, but after she decided to sit down right on the countertop - where the coffee gets  brewed and mugs are placed, on her phone. It was very unprofessional. I was just so confused that there was no supervision or management around because there was plenty of cleaning that could've been done.  Anyways, we finally got our food. With all that being said the food looked fresh and it was hot. The presentation of the plate was not the best and alittle sloppy, but the food was the least of the issues. However, our food was actually very good, I was impressed. This was probably on the top of my list of Greek places I tried. I ordered a Greek salad with chicken. Wow, it was so flavorful and it came with a side of pita. The seasoning on it was amazing. I also ordered a side of tzatziki sauce and it tasted amazing! It was thick with chunks of cucumbers. I could've ate a whole jar, I used it as a dressing on my whole salad.   While we were eating, there was an annoying fly bothering ever two minutes. My YELP bestie said the same thing happened to her last time she came in. I know it's hard to keep the flies away, but it was a bit irritating waving my arm trying to swat a fly. A few minutes later someone from the kitchen came out. He touched the remote of the television to change the channel with black gloves on. Standing there for a few minutes, he goes into the men's bathroom still with his gloves on. We were in shock! We were hoping he wouldn't come out with the same gloves on since it was odd. But guess what.. he did. I was completely dumbfounded in disgust. I mean common sense, that's a huge health violation. I lost my appetite.   My heart was broken. Coming from a hospitality and restaurant background these things are important to me. I love exploring exploring restaurants and trying new places with great reviews. So this killed me to see how a great restaurant was being neglected.

Photo of The Mad Greek of Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Witness a kitchen employee go into the restroom with gloves on and came out with gloves still on.

ACRJzVVcm9bs7h1WbtDPrQ.text: We were on this side of town and we were looking for Greek food. Saw good reviews so decided to stop by for lunch. When we arrived we were immediately seated. The staff was friendly and attentive.   We ordered the gyros and pork souvlaki pitas both with Greek fries. Both the pitas had good flavor and large portions. The $1.50 upgrade to the fries is definitely worth it! The tzatziki sauce was fresh and the best I have ever tasted.  I would visit again.

Photo of The Mad Greek of Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu 2
Photo of The Mad Greek of Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu 1

z5SirUrE1JFTVgAHp9TQ6Q.text: I found this on a list of good Greek places in Charlotte, so we stopped by for a team lunch the other day.   You really can't miss it on South Blvd. It's a bright blue building. Really what you think of when you think hole in the wall.   The menu has what you would expect from Greek food for the most part. There are many different pita options.   I went with the classic gyro pita and upgraded my fries to Greek fries (fries with lemon, feta, and herbs). I've had better gyros, but it was pretty good. The meat seemed kind of overcooked. I really like the fries.   While it's a sit-down restaurant, they don't bring your check to you. You pay at the counter when you're done. We weren't aware of this, so it would be nice if they made this more clear.   If you're looking for solid, casual Greek food, this is your place.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mad Greek of Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gyro with Greek fries

_AfsohOcpgflMK1nfTJbbA.text: Interesting name and good reviews - this is what got me to this place. Casual , spacious seating arrangement, good interiors. We went for a to go ! Quickly were given the menu cards and the server helped us with few options that were new to me. I wanted to try the Galaktoboureko from the dessert but they were out of it, instead picked up my all time favorite baklava. We got our order in less that 15 mins - impressive! Chicken souvlaki and skewers is what we ordered and I loved both the dishes,they came with side of salad and pita - wonderful Portion. Overall good place. Will visit again soon to get the Galaktoboureko!

Qkv7O0t4X9ZKYajHVWXvhw.text: Was doing work in the south part of town and had a craving for Greek.   I had been to Mad Greek before and wanted to grab a quick lunch.    Sat down and was greeted quickly.   I ordered the Gyro pita and the food came out pretty quickly.   I really enjoyed the Gyro and the ingredients were well seasoned and very fresh.   One thing that stood out was the tomatoes.  They tasted very fresh and had the fresh from the garden look.     Service was good and they made sure to check on me a few times.  Overall I really enjoyed the food and the service.   Would repeat.

vNdv0NIydpblBZo4aLAKlA.text: My husband and I are always on the hunt for amazing Greek food and this place has to be the best food I've ever had at any restaurant in my entire life! Everything from service to food was impeccable. Even the red onions and olives in the salad were amazing and I HATE olives and red onions. Our waitress Amanda was helpful and on point with every aspect of our dining experience while being busy with other tables and takeout orders. I wish I lived closer to this restaurant so I can eat here more often. This place is worth the trip! I can't wait to go back

uXCFz805RCV8b1pQ353cFQ.text: Best Greek food in town. Food and service are always outstanding! Portions are very generous and the food is always fresh. They offer a variety of Greek beers and wines. It is the only place in NC where I was able to get my favorite Greek beer ARIS. They also put major soccer matches on their big screen (I've watched  some UCL, Europa League, Super League Greece and International matches there). Sometimes I'd ask the staff to put a Premiere League match on a Saturday or Sunday morning when I show up to have a coffee( they offer a variety of hot/iced coffees, fredo espresso)  My favorite menu items are: 1. Pork Souvlaki Dinner 2. Meat Trio (when I'm very hungry) 3. Double Cheeseburger (one of the best burgers I've had)  Make sure you grab a piece of fresh homemade baklava on your way out!
